abstracts.cdata!:
The core objective of the Second Social
            Expenditure Management Project is to improve basic social
            services, by enhancing performance, and governance in the
            three social sector departments - Education, Health, and
            Social Welfare - which also includes the school building
            program, and the provision of quality inputs to such
            services. The components will: 1) strengthen key budgetary
            programs, covering the provision of educational inputs
            (textbooks, classrooms, and repairs/maintenance of existing
            schools); provision of public health services, through the
            procurement of drugs, vaccines, and supplies for effective
            public health programs (tuberculosis control, expanded
            immunization programs, and rabies' prevention and
            control); and, provision of social services through the
            comprehensive integrated delivery of social services
            (CIDSS), an activity centered in poor municipalities to
            accelerate basic services (water supply and sanitation,
            drainage systems, and waste disposal); 2) provide technical
            assistance (TA), and training to implement financial
            management systems, procurement, and information technology
            improvement programs. Furthermore, teacher deployment and
            human resources planning will be implemented under an
            improved allocation system, targeting teachers to the most
            needy schools. And, and action plan will improve the Bureau
            of Food and Drugs, by strengthening capacities, for improved
            standards; and, 3) provide TA and training to strengthen
            transparency and accountability of the budget process.
